Subjective: Spot on neck x2 weeks, started as small wound post-shaving, insect bite, swollen, reddish, itchy, scab falls off and reforms; No pain, no similar spots elsewhere; Social: No smoking/alcohol mentioned; Request: Worried about skin cancer, wants spot removed, prefers freezing method
Objective: Single raised lesion ~0.5cm, pinkish-red with redder center, no crusting currently; No palpable lymphadenopathy, no similar lesions on neck, only freckles; Photo taken for e-consult
Assessment: Unclear diagnosis, possibilities include pyogenic granuloma or atypical mole; R/O skin cancer
Plan: 1. Sent photo to dermatologist via e-consult, results expected by Friday. 2. Patient to call GP on Friday (before 10am or after 3pm) for dermatology advice. 3. Likely removal recommended - options are freezing, excision, or scraping with pathology. 4. Safety net: Call sooner if worsening symptoms. 5. Follow-up as needed based on dermatology recommendations.
